1.title: Trebuchet

episode of.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large (TV Series 2015– )

1.plot: Phil uses a trebuchet to hurl pumpkins and explains the history of the giant lever-based catapult.

2.title: Hydraulics

episode of.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large (TV Series 2015– )

2.plot: Using a small, syringe-powered hydraulic arm, Phil learns how to use Hydraulics to crush stuff.

3.title: Rotation

episode of.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large (TV Series 2015– )

3.plot: Phil experiments with the Magnus Effect, gyroscopic precession, pushing string and Da Vinci's perpetual motion wheel.

4.title: Geodesic Dome

episode of.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large (TV Series 2015– )

4.plot: Phil tries to make domes, gets the record in cup-stacking, builds a cube of pencils and a self-supporting bridge.

5.title: Slime

episode of.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large (TV Series 2015– )

5.plot: Phil demonstrates how many things are made out of long chains of molecules, from plastics and fabrics to DNA.

6.title: Antacid Rocket

episode of.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large (TV Series 2015– )

6.plot: Phil makes rockets using antacid tablets and water. Phil uses chemistry to make light and instant crystals.

7.title: Pumpkin Drop

episode of.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large (TV Series 2015– )

7.plot: Phil conducts an egg drop experiment with pumpkins.

8.title: Gravity Boat

episode of.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large (TV Series 2015– )

8.plot: Phil tries to max out a boat that propels itself using nothing but water and gravity.

9.title: Friction Slide

episode of.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large (TV Series 2015– )

9.plot: Phil conducts experiments that involve friction.

10.title: Mousetrap Boat

episode of.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large (TV Series 2015– )

10.plot: Phil explores how to make things go using propulsion and inertia.

11.title: Air Surfing

episode of.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large (TV Series 2015– )

11.plot: Air is fluid, just like water it can be surfed on with a tumblewing. Phil explores lots of different methods of flight all while maxxing out the tumblewing.

12.title: Nucleation Fountain

episode of.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large (TV Series 2015– )

12.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

13.title: Rube Goldberg Machine

episode of.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large (TV Series 2015– )

13.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Newton's 3rd Law

episode of.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large (TV Series 2015– )

1.plot: Phil builds a balloon powered car in the lab. Then he tries to make one big enough to ride. Can the Science Max build team find a big enough balloon? Or are balloons the way to go? Plus, Newton's Cradle out of bowling balls, how Guinea Pigs got their name and Newton's 3rd Law.

2.title: Elasticity

episode of.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large (TV Series 2015– )

2.plot: Phil starts with a Popsicle stick catapult. Then he uses everything he knows about elastic energy to build a full-size catapult that hurls pumpkins! Plus, a maxed out paddle wheel boat and a historical re-enactment (sort of) of how catapults were used in medieval days.

3.title: Friction

episode of.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large (TV Series 2015– )

3.plot: Phil starts with a balloon powered hover disc, then tries to make a maxed out version big enough to ride. In fact, why not make two and then race them! Phil also tries to use the power of friction to climb the walls and even to fly.

4.title: How You Build It

episode of.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large (TV Series 2015– )

4.plot: Ever wanted to build a bridge out of pasta? It's not too hard and works better than you'd think. But what if we were to try to make a pasta bridge big enough for Phil to walk across? Plus, learn how to build a sandcastle you can stand on!

5.title: Magnets

episode of.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large (TV Series 2015– )

5.plot: Magnets have poles - when you put opposite ones together, they attract. But when you but the same ones together, they repel. Could we find magnets powerful enough to repel each other and float Phil off the ground? Plus, watch magnets defy gravity all on their own.

6.title: Volume, Mass and Density

episode of.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large (TV Series 2015– )

6.plot: What makes boats float? Tinfoil doesn't float, but a boat made of tinfoil does. It's all about how you build it. Watch as Phil builds his human-sized tinfoil boat wrong several times before he figures it out. Plus, Phil gets into a tub full of the main ingredient in diapers. Why would he do such a thing? For Science!

7.title: Chemistry

episode of.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large (TV Series 2015– )

7.plot: The old 'vinegar and baking soda volcano' needs an overhaul. What happens if we use 60 times as much? What about using 100% acid? What about even more reactive chemicals? Plus, Phil coats his whole outfit in hydrophobic spray and gets in the pool. Will he stay dry? Find out!

8.title: Pressure

episode of.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large (TV Series 2015– )

8.plot: Learn how to use air pressure to make your own, home-made rocket out of a plastic water bottle. Phil maxes this out by using stronger bottles and even over-pressurizing them and finally by building a giant rocket out of plastic bottles. Plus, we blow up a bottle with liquid nitrogen and crush a steel drum using nothing but the air pressure around us every day.

9.title: Simple Machines

episode of.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large (TV Series 2015– )

9.plot: What good is Science if you can't use it to give you super strength? Phil does just that using the power of simple machines to move, lift and roll a machine he could barely budge otherwise. Plus, lift yourself with one finger and watch cavemen discover the wheel.

10.title: Solids, liquids & Gasses

episode of.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large (TV Series 2015– )

10.plot: Solid, Liquid, Gas and all the things in-between. What's in between? Cornstarch mud. Sometimes it's a liquid, but sometimes a solid. Phil fills a giant trough with it to see if it's solid enough to run across. Plus, giant rock candy, giant bubbles and a giant sledgehammer made out of a frozen pumpkin.

11.title: Air and Flight

episode of.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large (TV Series 2015– )

11.plot: Start by learning how to fold the paper airplane that won the long distance record. Then Phil tries to make a giant paper airplane to see if it will still fly. Turns out, its way harder than you'd think. Plus, terminal velocity and indoor tornadoes!

12.title: Balance

episode of.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large (TV Series 2015– )

12.plot: How can you balance a potato on a stick? And, more importantly, can Phil balance on a tightrope using the same science? What's better for balance, staying put or using something that spins? Phil walks the tightrope then designs a gyroscopic stabilization backpack.

13.title: Drag Racer

episode of.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large (TV Series 2015– )

13.plot: Phil builds a small drag racer in the lab that uses the inertia of its wheels to move. Then he tries to max it out. The final experiment involves a jacked up car and a large frame with Phil riding it. Plus, Newton's laws, pulling a tablecloth without breaking the dishes and a caveman trying to break down a door.

imdb.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large
plot: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting new series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
